age/length of experience, membership etc

sentences.english: His daughter, Emily, 16 is a junior in high school.
sentences.chinese: 他的女儿艾米丽芳龄16岁，是一名中学生。

sentences.english: One day is carousing in ward, this lets one fragrant age beautiful nurse sees.
sentences.chinese: 一日正在病房痛饮，这让一芳龄美丽的护士看到。

sentences.english: A simple maiden in her flower is worth a hundred coats of arms.
sentences.chinese: 正值芳龄的纯洁少女值一百枚勋章。

definition: (of a girl) in the prime of youth

one's age, according to the traditional Chinese method of reckoning (i.e. the number of Chinese calendar years in which one has lived). In this system, a person's age is one year at birth, and increases by one year at the beginning of the first solar term 立春[Li4 chun1] each year, rather than on one's birthday./as opposed to 足歲|足岁[zu2 sui4]/see also 實歲|实岁[shi2 sui4]
how old are you? (familiar, or to a child)
Pentium III microprocessor, abbr. for 奔騰三|奔腾三
to be pushing 30
middle-aged but still attractive woman/lady of a certain age
unmarried
to be in the prime of life
a girl's teenage years (idiom); maidenhood/a budding beauty
method of calculating a person's age in years from birth/see also 虛歲|虚岁[xu1 sui4]/see also 足歲|足岁[zu2 sui4]
lit. countenance of a flower, face like the moon (idiom)/fig. (of a woman) beautiful

older (than average in a group, at school, for marriage etc)
